Description: Join me for a wholesome afternoon foraging in nature with spectacular sea views ending with a fun eco printing session in a local pub. Create your own textile print from oak and blackberry leaves on authentic Irish linen and bring it home as a decorative piece of art or wear as a trendy scarf! Our journey begins at the base of Killiney Hill, a beloved public park nestled beside the quaint seaside village of Dalkey. Only half an hour from the city, these woodlands are well worth a visit and you will earn great insight from me as a deep-rooted local! I will guide you through the woods as we gather leaves to be used in our eco printing session. After a leisurely hike to the Obelisk at the top of the hill, take in dazzling views of Dublin Bay and its mountains...I might even point out a few tree tops from the backyard of a certain U2 frontman‚Äôs humble abode! Our foraging trip will end back at the base of the hill in the cosy and picturesque Druids Chair Pub, where I will lead you in the centuries‚Äô old technique of eco printing. The natural pigments from the plants are released onto the textile, capturing the intricate details, dyes and unique shape of the leaves. You will create a one-of-a-kind design that is not only beautiful but also friendly to the environment. Each piece is a reflection of the natural world and the colours and patterns found in it, making them truly special and meaningful. A superb way to create a lasting reminder of a day well spent in nature and by the Irish sea. A very happy group with their finished eco print creations! Making our way through the woods to forage for leaves Arriving at the Obelisk at the top of Killiney Hill Stunning views of Dublin Bay A collection of oak and blackberry leaves to be used for eco printing on Irish linen Preparing the linen and leaves for eco printing Carefully placing the leaves on the linen creating a unique design Irish linen eco printed with the natural dyes of blackberry and oak leaves A fininshed linen eco print displayed as a wall hanging A fininshed linen eco print worn as a stylish scarf A finished linen eco print turned into a gorgeous nature inspired cushion cover
Title: A Foraging Stroll Up Killiney Hill & Eco-Printing With Irish Linen
Subtitle: Spend a wholesome afternoon in nature - gathering leaves, taking in spectacular sea views and getting crafty with plants and Irish linen.

Description: Please read important info till end. About this event An opportunity to learn Basic, Intermediate and Advance level of IET in one weekend. What is IET? Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ (IET¬Æ) is one of the next generation ‚Äì hands on ‚Äì power energy therapy systems that get the ‚Äúissues out of your tissues‚Äù for good! Developed at the Center of Being, by Stevan J. Thayer, IET uses the violet angelic energy ray, as brought to us through the nine Healing Angels of the Energy Field, to work directly with your 12 Strand Spiritual DNA. IET supports you in safely and gently releasing limiting energy patterns of your past, empowering and balancing your life in the present, and helps you to reach for the stars as you evolve into your future. We chose the term ‚ÄúIntegrated‚Äù in our name to convey our healing vision of ‚Äúintegrating the pain of the past, into the power of the present, to bring about the joy of the future‚Äù. We have been privileged to see Integrated Energy Therapy live up to this vision. The IET¬Æ Mission is to ‚ÄúHeal the world one-heart-at-a-time‚Äù. Since 1994 when Stevan began teaching IET¬Æ he asked the angels to help spread IET beyond its origins in New Jersey to New York, or even New England. The angels have done this and more. Today there are IET students in 75 countries including Australia, Croatia, Hungary, Denmark, Guatemala, Nepal, Slovenia, Sweden, and Uzbekistan. We are truly honoured and blessed by what the angels (and the IET Master-Instructor Earth Angels) have done. Basic Level Our Basic Level Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Training class: Prerequisites: This is our entry-level class and there are no prerequisites required for attendance at this class. Description: Even though we call this class ‚Äúbasic level‚Äù this class provides you with everything you need to do a powerful Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ session on yourself or on another person (either in person or absentee). This class has been designed to be a wonderful entry level class for those students wanting to use energy therapy to heal their lives, an ideal class for students wanting to begin an energy therapy practice, and it provides a wonderful complement to other holistic techniques such as Massage, Reiki, and Therapeutic Touch. Only IET Master-Instructors are authorized to teach this class. Basic Attunement: You will receive a special Basic Level ‚Äúenergy attunement‚Äù that will permanently open your energy field to the power of Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Basic level ray. Our Basic Level attunement expands, realigns, and restructures the 1st pair (physical) and 2nd pair (emotional) of your 12 Strand DNA. Once attuned to the Basic Level IET Ray, you will have the ability to clear cellular memory of physical and emotional blockages. Angelic Heartlinks: Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ is known as ‚ÄúHealing with the Energy of Angels‚Äù. You will learn to access the energy of angels through a simple yet powerful process that we call a Heartlink. A ‚Äúheartlink‚Äù is a connection made with the angelic realm in which you visualize a golden chord going from your heart, through your throat, up through your head and then up to the angelic realm or to a specific angel, usually Angel Ariel or one of the other ‚ÄúHealing Angels of the Energy Field‚Äù. Once your Heartlink has been established, you will learn how to send love up to the angelic realm or that specific angel and you will find that the love returned is multiplied from the angels to further assist you in the healing of yourself or others. This Heartlink is invaluable in and of itself, however, when it is used in conjunction with the accessing of the energy system, it becomes extremely powerful and effective. The Magic Presence by M. DaCamara, copyright 1942 St. Germain Press, is a good depiction of a Heartlink Clearing Cellular Memory: you will learn about the nine cellular memory areas where we can unconsciously store ‚Äúissues in our tissues‚Äù that can negatively affect our life. More importantly, you will learn simple yet powerful techniques to get the issues out of your tissues (as well as out of the tissues of others). Clearing of cellular memory is made quick and easy by means of nine sets of Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Integration Points that allow you to energize, integrate, and clear the nine cellular memory areas. Special Empowerment Imprints: In Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ clearing harmful energy blocks is only half the task. After energy blocks are cleared, you will learn to channel angelic energy to form an empowerment imprint that fills the cellular memory with the opposite of what you cleared. For example, you will learn to clear the energy of guilt and imprint the energy of innocence. Class Length: 1 day (approx. 8 hours). This class is designed to be taught in one day, and typically runs from 9:30 AM to 5:30 PM. The actual length and times of class vary by individual Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Master-Instructors. Class Materials: you will receive a fully illustrated 26 page Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Basic Level Guide and an official Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Basic Level Certificate. Intermediate Level Our Intermediate Level Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Training class: Prerequisites: Completion of the Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Basic Level class is required for attendance at this class. Description: This class is the next step in our Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ training system and it builds on all of the knowledge and techniques learned in our Basic Level training. Our Intermediate Level training expands upon both the depth and the breadth of the Basic Level techniques through the Intermediate Attunement (which opens you to clear mental and karmic imprints) and through the special Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ pullout-release technique that lets you clear imprints from the human energy field. Only IET Master-Instructors are authorized to teach this class. Intermediate Attunement: You will receive a special Intermediate Level ‚Äúenergy attunement‚Äù that will further open your energy field to the power of Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Intermediate Level ray. Our Intermediate Level attunement expands, realigns, and restructures the 3rd pair (mental) and 4th pair (karmic) of your 12 Strand DNA. Once attuned to the Intermediate Level IET Ray, you will have the ability to pull physical, emotional, mental, and karmic energy imprints out of the human energy field. Clearing The Human Energy Field: You will learn the special Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ pullout-release technique that will turn your hands into ‚Äúenergy magnets‚Äù that will allow you to easily attract and clear harmful energy imprints from the human energy field. This will allow you to clear even more difficult energy blockages. As part of this training, you will also be taught to feel and interpret energy blockages and identify the level (physical, emotional, mental, or karmic) that the energy blockages occur. You will also learn the special ‚Äúpink bubble technique‚Äù that will further accelerate the clearing process. Class Length: 1 day (approx. 8 hours). This class is designed to be taught in one day, and typically runs from 9:30 AM to 5:30 PM. The actual length and times of class vary by individual Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Master-Instructors. Class Materials: You will receive a fully illustrated 26 page Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Intermediate Level Guide and an official Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Intermediate Level Certificate. Advanced Level Our Advanced Level Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Training class: Prerequisites: Completion of the Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Intermediate Level class is required for attendance at this class. Description: This class builds on all of the knowledge and techniques learned in our Basic and Intermediate Level trainings. While our Basic and Intermediate Level classes are focused on clearing cellular memory and the human energy field, our Advanced Level training is focused on helping you live your soul‚Äôs mission and bringing your dreams alive. Only IET Master-Instructors are authorized to teach this class. Advanced Attunement: You will receive a special Advanced Level ‚Äúenergy attunement‚Äù that will further open your energy field to the power of Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Advanced Level ray. Our Advanced Level attunement expands, realigns, and restructures the 4th pair (soul profile) and 5th pair (soul cluster) of your 12 Strand DNA. Once attuned to the Advanced Level IET Ray, you will have the ability to discover your soul‚Äôs mission and attract members of your soul‚Äôs cluster to help you live your soul‚Äôs mission and bring your dreams alive. Your Soul‚Äôs Mission: Every soul incarnates with a special mission that is not only perfect for that soul but is an integral part of the higher divine plan. The Advanced Level energy attunement will open you to a deeper connection with your 8th chakra (called the soul star) where the complete plan for your soul‚Äôs mission is stored. You will learn how to tap into the soul star energy and better understand your soul‚Äôs mission through the creation of a vision board. You will also learn about the four E‚Äôs of living your soul‚Äôs mission and how energy blockages can prevent you from living your mission. Muscle Tension ‚Äì Relaxation Techniques: The deep energy blockages that can prevent you from living your soul‚Äôs mission can easily be released through the special Advanced Level Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ muscle tension ‚Äì relaxation techniques. These techniques applied to the arms and legs will accelerate you in the living of your soul‚Äôs mission. Soul Star Clearing: This Advanced Level technique lets you work directly with the 8th chakra to activate the energy of the soul‚Äôs mission and focus angelic energy to bring your dreams alive. Heartbeams ‚Äì Healing the Earth: As an Advanced Level practitioner, you will be able to give back to Mother Earth by establishing columns of Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ energy into the Earth called Heartbeams. Once established, these columns provide a permanent anchor of angelic healing energy into the Earth. These can be used to heal areas of the Earth that have suffered from human or natural devastation. Not only will Heartbeams offer healing to the Earth, but they will also offer healing to anyone who passes through them. As an Advanced Level Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ practitioner, you can place Heartbeams in your home and office. You can also place them at the entrances to schools, hospitals, train stations, airports, and anywhere lots of people will pass through. Class Materials: you will receive a fully illustrated 34 page Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Advanced Level Guide and an official Integrated Energy Therapy¬Æ Advanced Level Certificate. Description: CREATIVE HANDBUILDING WORKSHOP (2 HOURS)  SUNDAYS 2.30-4.30PM ABOUT THIS WORKSHOP This workshop is a great introduction to working with clay using handbuilding techniques, and you will be amazed at the skills you will learn, and what you can make during this half-day class. Before ceramicists invented the pottery wheel, handbuilding was the only way to create functional and artistic ceramic forms. The oldest known ceramic artifact was handbuilt and is dated as early as 28,000 BC.   All you need to get started is clay, tools, your hands and creative enthusiasm.  We‚Äôll supply the clay and tools, and our expert teacher to guide and teach you -  and you bring your hands and creative enthusiasm!  LEARNING OUTCOMES You will learn how to make a pot or vessel through a variety of hand building techniques including: - handling your clay - working with your pottery tools - utilizing coiling, slabbing, pinching, building, and sculpting methods - shaping your piece You may take as many of your pots home with you as you like (please note the pots will airdry over a few days and may then be used for display - they will not be glazed or watertight). Please bring small boxes (like Tupperware or cardboard) to bring your creations home with you.  If you would like to give this workshop as a gift please take a look at our Gift Cards here. Where: This workshop runs for 2 hours in our lovely Arran Street East studio at number 43/44 Arran Street East, Dublin 7 - right in the heart of the Dublin Fruit and Vegetable Markets area. Eircode: D07 W226 Google map. Materials: We'll provide all the materials you'll need, but please bring your own apron and towel to prevent your clothes getting wet with clay.   Add Glazing Workshop for ‚Ç¨75 CANCELLATION POLICY Please ensure that you, or the individual you are gifting the workshop to, can attend the workshop.  Unfortunately, we are not in the position to offer refunds for our workshops. We can reschedule your workshop if you notify us 3 weeks before your workshop.  However, you may transfer your workshop booking to someone else, if you yourself cannot attend. Please email us as soon as possible before the course with the name and contact information of the person taking your place.  FÔªøAQs 1.Who is this course for? This workshop will suit beginners looking for an introduction to working with clay, or those who have worked with clay  before and would like a simple refresher. 2. Is there an age limit for the Workshop? This course is generally for people aged 18 and above. A teenager over 15 may attend if they are accompanied by an adult. Please let us know in advance.  3. Do I need to bring anything?  Please bring an apron or an oversized T-shirt with you - this is to cover your clothes from water and clay splashes. Dress comfortably so that you do not mind getting splattered in clay (which washes out in any event).Bring your own handtowel to wipe your hands off from clay and water. You will be able to see your pots better if you keep your hair tied back, and it is important to have your nails short if you‚Äôre throwing on the wheel.  4. Should I wear a mask? As per the government's regulations masks are not mandatory during the workshop.  5. COVID19:  Please follow HSE recommendations if you have symptoms or if you tested positive for Covid19. Hand sanitizers are supplied for your use before, during, and after your class. We are required to keep the windows open for ventilation purposes. 6. Is my booking transferrable? You may transfer your booking into someone else's name. 7. Where can I contact you? If you have any questions please email us at workshops@arranstreeteast.ie.
Title: CREATIVE HANDBUILDING WORKSHOP (2 HOURS)
Subtitle: Coil, slab, pinch, build and sculpt ‚Äì there is so much you can do with clay!

Description: Vision Board Workshop Join us for a fun and inspiring Vision Board Workshop at Endless Fulfillment ! This in-person event will take place on Sunday, at 10:00 AM in Dublin 11. A vision board workshop with ceremonial cacao can be a powerful tool for personal growth and manifestation. It allows for a unique and inspiring experience that can leave you feeling motivated and energized to pursue your dreams in 2024. A vision board is a powerful tool that helps you visualize your goals and aspirations. It's a collage of images, words, and affirmations that represent what you want to attract into your life. During this workshop, you'll have the opportunity to unleash your creativity and manifest your dreams for 2024. There will be an option to create your vision board journal and I will explain you the different between Vision Board and Vision Board Journaling and the benefit to using the Journal instead of the Board. There will be an option to get your own Vision Board Journal for additional 10‚Ç¨ on the day. To enhance the experience, we will have ceremonial cacao served as an option. Ceremonial cacao is a type of chocolate that has been used in traditional Mayan and Aztec ceremonies for centuries. It is believed to have spiritual and medicinal properties that can aid in emotional healing, creativity, and spiritual growth. The cacao is optional, we will also have tea, coffee and some snacks served on the day. We will start with drinking a small cup of the cacao while setting our intentions for the workshop and getting to know each other. The cacao will help you to relax and connect with your inner selves. I will guide you through the process of creating your own vision board. You'll also receive helpful tips and techniques to make your vision board truly impactful. Bring your favourite magazines, photos, and inspiring quotes to create a personalized vision board that reflects your dreams and desires. We encourage you to bring anything that you may have. We will have some magazines and prints available to use on the day. By the end of the workshop, you'll have a beautiful and personalized vision board or journal that serves as a visual reminder of your dreams and motivates you to take action towards achieving them. Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity to envision your 2024 and have some fun ! This in-person event is the first step in turning your dreams into a reality! This is a great gift for friends and family! The workshop created for small group Reserve your spot today and get ready to bring your dreams to life! This workshop will combine collaging and coaching techniques to help you create your own unique vision board to take home. I am a qualified holistic life coach and a reiki master. Since I had completed my coaching certification I have been supporting people on their journey towards a fulfilling life . If you have any questions, you can contact us via the following: Instagram: @endlessfulfillment Email: andrea@endless-fulfillment.com Phone: +353 83 00 89 811
Title: Vision Board Workshop with Ceremonial Cacao
Subtitle: Get ready to unleash your creativity and manifest your dreams at our Vision Board Workshop, where we'll guide you in crafting a vision board

Description: Second Sunday Circle ‚Äì mindfulness and council circle practice The Spring - Summer circles will take place on Sundays March 10th, April 14th, May 12th and June 9th. Common Ground loft room, 5 ‚Äì 6.30pm Cost: ‚Ç¨10/‚Ç¨5 conc Facilitator: Niamh Barrett along with other co-facilitators Sitting in circle in turbulent times This series of mindfulness and circle sessions will invite our experiences and stories of this moment, in our own lives and in the midst of upheaval in our societies and on our planet. This 1.5 hour session will begin with a short (15 min) mindfulness practice of bodyscan, gentle movement or sitting meditation guided by one of its facilitators, before moving into council circle practice. Council circle practice has developed and flourished in many traditions over countless generations. In our time it's continuing as a way of nourishing ourselves and others by gathering in community to bear witness and to listen and speak from the heart. Niamh Barrett is a mindfulness facilitator who is affiliated with the Mindfulness Teachers‚Äô Association of Ireland. https://mtai.ie/teachers/niamh-barrett/ She is a student of the Way of Council (circle facilitation) as a core mindfulness practice and works to bring it more deeply into her life by regularly attending council circles, training workshops and retreats and by offering circles in her local community of Bray and online. P lease feel welcome to get in touch with Niamh with any questions at 086 2857212 or hello@showingup.ie Image: Mikko Ijas
Title: Second Sunday circle series - Sitting in circle in turbulent times
Subtitle: A mindfulness and council circle session on the second Sunday of each month. This Spring's theme is 'Sitting in circle in turbulent times'.

Description: It's all about what you Relish and finding someone to Relish those things with. If you're tired of online dating, exhausted by meeting someone only to discover they're nothing like their profile - we offer an alternative. Bringing together comfortably chic venues with a cosmopolitan sensibility. A sophisticated no frills approach to singles events. We've done away with the whistles, name-tags and over the top party trimmings. Unparalleled service and personable hosts all in an environment - just your speed. A fresh alternative to typical events that seem more like a job fair than a relaxed way to connect. Whether it be a romantic dinner, wine tasting, concert or festival - bar crawl or fitness class - maybe even a Mud Run! Do what you Relish with whom you Relish. Saturday Night Speed Dating @ The Jar - March 10th 2024 Ages: 27-42 | 7PM 31 Wexford St, Portobello, Dublin 2, D02 K232, Ireland For more information visit us at: DoRelish.com Or email us at: info@dorelish.com http://www.dorelish.com We think the best relationships are forged when we are comfortable, relaxed and free of pressure. Preferring instead to think of the evening as a casual night out where one can truly be themselves. We do not use traditional 'speed dating' offerings such as bells, whistles and name-tags. Instead we focus on creating an atmosphere conducive to meeting others; a great venue, a personable host and a staff to assist. Upon registration, you'll be sent an email inviting you to login to your mobile ‚ÄòSmart-Card‚Äô. As the event begins, log-in to your scorecard and let the flirting begin. You'll be able to choose whom you wish to meet again, to what degree you like them and have until midnight to submit your final selections for matching. Once the clock strikes midnight - return to our platform to see your matches. You can also access your profile via mobile, tablet or PC. Our platform isn't an app so it requires absolutely no downloading and can be accessed directly from our website, anytime. Should you have any questions - feel free to ask away. Take the time before the event starts to settle in - have a beverage if you would like and mingle should you wish. Chat up our Hosts for tips or simply to ask, which direction the bar is in! After being shown to your table, the ladies will remain seated for the duration of the event. The gents move from lovely lady to lovely lady every six to seven minutes. Your mobile scorecard gives you the ability to see all the participants attending your event, upload your picture, make your selections and be notified of your matches all from your phone. Don't fret about figuring out if the person is the one or the perfect person for you. Consider it the date before the date. If you choose someone and they chose you - it's a match. You will be given each others first name and email address. The rest is up to you. If you are interested in reading about our Blind-Date Matchmaking with packages ranging from ‚Ç¨562 - ‚Ç¨892, please click here. Need a bit of advice or guidance? From profiles to relationship coaching, learn more about our Advice Packages by clicking here.

Subtitle: Dublin Speed Dating | Saturday Singles Night | Do You Relish? | Ages 27-42

Description: SUSO are delighted to present a showing of the freshly re-developed show "The Rehearsal". We are so proud of these women who screened this play last year to great acclaim and received funding from Creative Ireland to develop it further. Having worked with director Nicole Rourke and Eimear Crehan, the show is back better than ever. Covering themes of friendship, marraige, career, politics, relationships, children and common sense, this play will have you laughing, crying and thinking about the meaning of life!  This show is set at a choir rehearsal, where the choir director is late and the women are left to their own devices of chats, debates, singing, warm ups and lots of great humour. "The Rehearsal is absolutely brilliant, really thought provoking and inspiring... my only complaint is that it needs to be longer - I could have watched this show for hours!!"
Title: The Rehearsal - SUSO Refired Choir
Subtitle: A play about life, love, friendship, laughter, singing and survival!

Description: The Dining Club is a unique experience that encourages community, drawing guests together in an intimate, convivial atmosphere while showcasing our passion for food and hospitality. Traversing past and present and deeply rooted in a sense of place, The Dining Club sees chefs Kelly Keogh (Whitestown House) and James Gabriel Martin (Leviathan) curating dining events with a focus on seasonality, heritage and story-telling. Each one is unique, designed around a theme, with changing menus, entertainment, and table settings. Whitestown House Estate, nestled near The Naul in North County Dublin, is set on 125 acres of farm and parkland. The historic demesne has remained intact since the 1600s and has a long and storied history of hospitality, marking it as the perfect venue for our events. The house was designed for entertaining. Guests are welcomed into the drawing room for pre-lunch champagne cocktails and canap√©s. The legendary long table in the dining room can accommodate up to 18 guests, and by its very design encourages connection and conversation. In the winter months, candlelight and crackling open fires bathe all of the rooms in a warm, welcoming glow. In the spring and summer months we host woodland gatherings beneath an ancient fern-leaved beech tree on the property and have picnics on the lawn. A Champagne Luncheon As the springtime light begins to brighten the land and the days become longer, we invite you to join us for an intimate and engaging lunchtime event, the very first of its kind for The Dining Club. Guests will first be greeted with champagne cocktails and canap√©s, as well as live music to set the mood. Following that you will be invited into the dining room to take your seat at the long table for an intimate four-course lunch, including a complimentary wine pairing that has been carefully selected by Nisea Doddy, Head Sommelier at The Shelbourne Hotel, Dublin. We also have very special handcrafted non-alcoholic drinks by Majken Bech Bailey (Bech-Bailey) for our guests. Taking place on Mother's Day weekened 2024, this event is the perfect opportunity to celebrate those that are special to you. Chefs Kelly Keogh and James Gabriel Martin will be serving dishes inspired by this time of year, utilising the freshest seasonal ingredients to hand. Let us celebrate what nature has given us, unwind and dine. *Important Information* The Dining Club is run by a team of two chefs, working closely on a small scale. Due to the nature of this project, we are unable to cater for specific allergies. A vegetarian option is available. We offer an ever-changing multi-course tasting menu featuring an array of products. We work with very specific numbers and on a tight budget, therefore cancellations have a huge impact on our ability to host. Cancellation and refunds are possible up to 7 days before the event. Ticket price includes all booking fees. Access details are below in the FAQ section. *Please Note* This is an adult-only event
Title: The Dining Club Presents:  A Celebratory Champagne Luncheon
Subtitle: Join us for a specially crafted four-course dining experience held in Whitestown House, a historic Irish estate in County Dublin.

Description: Hear about the history and engaging legends associated with Kilranelagh. Learn about the mysterious Tuatha De Danann and the fascinating heroes of old. Get away into nature to explore our forgotten past. This is the real ancient Ireland, where you‚Äôll escape the crowds and find the Ireland you‚Äôve always dreamed of.  We will start at the Boleycarrigeen entrance barrier to Kilranelagh hill.  From there our walk will take us past the view of the huge hill figures on Keadeen and hear the fascinating legend associated with it.  We will then make our way past a ruined house on our way to find a cairn hidden away in a beautiful forest clearing. After that we will visit the Boleycarrigeen stone circle. From here we will also take in the views of Keadeen's mysterious Cursus and Cairn. We will finish the tour with Crossoona Rath with its Ogham stone and the battle place of Michael Dwyer and the Irish rebels. The fascinating stories associated with each place will transport you to another time and place. These sites are not easily accessed without guidance, they are hidden gems, untouched and wild, not to be missed. Please note: The walk is about 2.5 hours long and is a hill walk on uneven ground, so please wear appropriate footwear for hillwalking and bring warm waterproof clothing in case of bad weather. Please also bring a snack and something to drink. Directions and Parking:  Follow the directions on Google maps to Kilranelagh Graveyard. Keep going straight past the sign to the graveyard which you will see on your right. Follow the narrow road which will incline steadily with a few gentle twists. Just before the road starts to slope steeply downwards you will see a forest entry barrier gate. Across the road from the barrier there is space for parking for a few cars. Please do not obstruct the barrier gate when parking. Other Kilranelagh tours: There are 3 walking tours on Kilranelagh hill for different interests and  fitness levels - to view the other tours, please follow this link:  https://www.eventbrite.ie/cc/guided-walking-tours-of-kilranelagh-hill-1583199
Title: Kilranelagh Rings Guided Walking Tour Special now on Winter prices!
Subtitle: Discover the wonderful Kilranelagh Hill in West  Wicklow. 2.5 hour walking tour featuring Crossoona Rath and Boleycarrigeen Stone Circle.

Description: The transformative game of life, Leela, is a working model of the Great Game, developed in ancient times and reaching the western world thanks to Harish Johari, an Indian artist, sculptor, composer, musician, singer, teacher and philosopher, who in 1975 published the book "Leela. The Game of Knowledge". Leela's philosophy is a quintessence of Vedic knowledge. The ancient yogis, after exploring the maze of human mind, identified 72 initial states of being and consciousness, and these states correspond to the 72 boxes of the game of Leela. The most ancient game of self-knowledge, Leela, is a gift for every human being on the path. By using this game as a mirror of real life, you can save many years. Years that you would have spent searching for the path that brought you into this incarnation, that made you incarnate. The Game of Leela is a self-discovery tool that allows you to " test the route " and, if necessary, to adjust your direction of movement. Leela is one of the systems of self-knowledge, a way to know life and the laws of the Universe. Game mechanics: the player rolls the dice, allowing karmic forces to determine the next move on the board. He travels through the different planes of existence, ascending with arrows and descending with snakes, in order to become aware of the intentions of his Higher Self wherever he finds himself.

Description: 1 ticket is for 2 people. Please bring 1 yoga mat between each pair. Each individual will also need paper/journal and a pen. Partner yoga is always a fun experience - you will laugh your way through the practice with whoever you decide to bring. Yes, this event is on Mother's Day but you don't need to be a mother to join. This partner yoga session will be a fun, engaging workshop to bring people together to celebrate divine feminine energy. So if you're not a mum, you are welcome. If you are a mum, you are welcome. If you just want to try yoga in a new, way you are welcome. Bring your mum for Mother's Day, or maybe your Mother's Day treat this year is having a laugh with your friends away from your motherly duties for an hour and a half. We will start with our yoga session, followed by a short journaling exercise and mindfulness practice. The event will start at 4.15pm and end at 5.45pm. Coppenagh House Farm are keeping their coffee hut open late just for us, so you can grab a hot cuppa before we start. This event will take place outdoors. The coffee hut has a shed roof but is open at the sides so please dress warm. There will be blankets onsite but please feel free to bring your own to be cosy. If you have any questions please contact Katie through @ModernDayYoga_ on Instagram. I'll see you on the mat, Katie x *Please note that by purchasing this ticket you agree to the T's&Cs that the facilitator and the venue are not liable for any damages to person or belongings, during or as as a result of participating in this event.
Title: Partner Yoga - Grab your bestie <3
Subtitle: Grab your best friend, sister, mother or other half for a fun outdoor partner yoga session.

Description: Lets face it, you can always spend more quality time with your mammy. So this mother's day, we're bringing you a very special edition of our Cocktail Canvas Club. Grab your mammy and get her down to mo's where our host, Hannah Rosaria, will take you step by step to each create your own masterpiece. It's the perfect down time for some real conversation but with enough to do that she won't be nagging you too much either! Don't worry if your mammy can't be there, you can always come with friends or family and paint your piece with her in mind. And sure to top it off you get to be in Mo Chara sipping on cocktails. If you know of a better way to spend Mother's Day please let us know, we'd be up for it. Your ticket, priced at just ‚Ç¨40 each, includes all the necessary paint materials, canvas and two top notch cocktails from our hand crafted menu. The session will take place in our outdoor gaird√≠n to guarantee the perfect laid back vibes. The area is fully covered and heated too so don't worry but bring a coat if you run cold. If the weather is very bad we may move it to upstairs in Quaglinos. Date: Sunday, 10/03/24 Time: 4 PM - 6 PM Venue: Mo Chara Tickets: ‚Ç¨40 Our kitchen is closed from 4-5pm. So make sure to plan ahead and come in early for a wee coffee/sambo/eggs as we wont be able to serve you food at your table while you're painting. Or stick around for a pizza after. We have Mel Jones & Odhran Murphy playing live music that evening also for all those planning to hang round for a few scoops after! Limited availability, so don't sleep on it. Note: This event is for attendees aged 20 and over.
Title: Mother's Day Cocktail Canvas Club
Subtitle: Grab your mammy and get down to Mo Chara for a fun filled Sunday afternoon at our Mother's Day Edition of our Cocktail Canvas Club!

Description: Stratford Rise:  Stratford Rise are a new breed of experimental noise rock from Bangor, N.I. Citing influences including DNA and This Heat, to XTC and Gilla Band, they pumped out their frantic debut single Water Running Through Faucet in August of last year. Latest Release ‚ÄòWorlds Fair‚Äô finds Stratford Rise blending jazz, noise rock, funk, no-wave, disco and pop through harsh noise, raw guitar, and angular rhythms, not to mention danceable grooves. Dead and Loving it:  "From down below, Dead & Loving It are making catchy alt rock tunes with big washy shoegaze guitars, taking inspiration from artists like Pixies, Deftones and Failure." Tonedeaf: Definitely Sound
Title: Stratford Rise - Dead and Loving it - Tonedeaf
Subtitle: Belfast noise-rock group are joined by 'Dead and Loving it' and Dublin's 'Tonedeaf' for what is sure to be a loud and thrilling experience.

Description: Why? We don't exercise enough in Ireland and when we do it's almost always cardiovascular exercise (heart health) that gets promoted. The equally important resistance exercises that support our bones, muscles and joints don't get nearly enough attention. parkHIIT's mission is to change that by promoting the importance of resistance exercise through our free weekly workouts. Impact parkHIIT removes barriers. The first barrier we remove is the intimidation barrier. Many people think resistance exercise or strength training means lifting heavy weights in a gym. With parkHIIT, we show how simple resistance exercise can be with our free introductory bodyweight only workouts in a fun outdoor group setting.  We also remove the financial barrier. parkHIIT workouts are free! Location Here is the exact spot we meet for parkHIIT Phoenix Park. We'll meet just before 10.00am. Come early to check in and say hello! What can I expect? - 5 minute warm up. - 20 minutes of (reasonably) high intensity. We'll complete a circuit based on bodyweight only resistance exercises. - 5 minute warm down. Click here to find out more about parkHIIT and why it's free.  Want to bring parkHIIT to your workplace? Find out about parkHIIT @ Work through this link.  Who Am I Up Against? You're only up against one person at parkHIIT and that's yourself. You push yourself as hard as you can/want! Rain, hail or shine we will be working out. Email brian@parkhiit.com with any questions.  What Do I Need to Bring? If you don't like grass (wet or otherwise) please bring your own mat. Wear comfortable clothing and footwear and be prepared for the (Irish) weather. Bring a bottle of water and your own bodyweight. You should keep a social distance from everyone else. Registration You MUST register in order to participate in parkHIIT. We work out in rain, hail or shine so please don't register unless you are certain to attend. By registering you agree to all the terms and conditions outlined below. You don't need to print your ticket but you must check in with the host before working out. FYI we may take some photos and videos to help promote future events. Terms and Conditions You should not take part in parkHIIT if you: - have a heart condition - have had chest pain in the past month - lose consciousness or lose your balance because of dizziness - have a joint or bone problem that may be made worse by a change in your physical activity - are currently taking medications for your blood pressure or heart condition - are pregnant - know of any other reason you should not exercise or increase your physical activity By attending parkHIIT you agree that you meet none of the criteria above and if you do you confirm that you have had clearance from your GP before taking part. By attending parkHIIT you confirm your understanding and acceptance that: - parkHIIT is not a class. It is an outdoor exercise session where each individual is responsible for their own workout. - parkHIIT events are free to participants and are run by volunteers. - Participants choose to take part in a parkHIIT workout at their own risk and without express permission from the parkHIIT organisers or the park or council authorities. - parkHIIT is a physically active endeavour. You should always seek advice from your GP before taking up a strenuous physical pursuit such as this. - By joining a parkHIIT session you accept that you are doing so entirely at your own risk and that it is your responsibility to ensure that you are fit and able enough to take part in the event. - parkHIIT is for over 16's only - You will be contacted via email regarding future parkHIIT events and initiatives. You can unsubscribe at any time. - parkHIIT, its volunteers, the park or council authorities do not accept responsibility for injury, loss and damage sustained by a participant. See you on Sunday morning! Brian
Title: parkHIIT Phoenix Park
Subtitle: parkHIIT is a social enterprise promoting the importance of resistance exercise through our free weekly workouts in local parks.

Description: Women in Sport Walk n Talk Bray Head Meeting point : Bandstand Bray Walking leader: Lisa Redmond WEAR PROPER SUPPORTED FOOTWEAR  Walkers will enjoy the scenic coastal view from Bray Head. At the top of Bray Head, there is a stone cross which was placed there in 1950 during the Holy Year. From here you get a magnificent panoramic vista of Bray, North East Wicklow and Dublin Bay. You can also see some of Bray Head‚Äôs neighbouring mountains, the Great and Little Sugar Loaf and Carrickgollogan, locally known as Kathy Gallagher. Walking is a simple and accessible form of exercise that offers numerous benefits for individuals of all ages and fitness levels. Walking has positive effects on mental health and well-being. It stimulates the release of endorphins, which are natural mood-boosting chemicals in the brain, leading to reduced stress, improved mood, and increased feelings of happiness. Walking in nature or green spaces can provide additional benefits by promoting relaxation, reducing anxiety, and enhancing mental clarity. We kindly request that you only book events that you genuinely intend to participate in. No-shows and last-minute cancellations impact planning and prevent others from seizing these valuable opportunities. By responsibly booking and promptly cancelling if needed, you actively contribute to our goal of empowering women in outdoor activities. Thank you for your understanding and support.
Title: Women in Sport Walk n Talk Bray Head
Subtitle: Women in Sport Bray Head

Description: Booked for the Weekend - Book Of the Month: "Normal People" by Sally Rooney Join us for an exciting in-person event on Sunday, March 10, 2024 at 16:00 GMT at Beckett Locke, North Docks. We are thrilled to discuss the captivating novel "Normal People" by Sally Rooney, our book of the month. Get ready to dive into the lives of Connell and Marianne as we explore their complex relationship and the challenges they face growing up in Ireland. This intimate gathering will provide a unique opportunity to share your thoughts, engage in lively discussions, and connect with fellow book lovers. Whether you're a devoted fan of Sally Rooney or new to her work, this event promises to be a memorable experience. Bring your questions, insights, and enthusiasm for an evening of literary exploration. Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity to engage with the book and fellow readers. Mark your calendar and get Booked for the Weekend!
Title: Booked for the Weekend - Book Of the Month: "Normal People" by Sally Rooney

Description: Embrace the enchanting beauty of the changing seasons through the captivating artwork featured at the upcoming exhibition, "The 4 Seasons," hosted from March 5th to March 11th. This week-long event promises to be a delightful celebration of nature's ever-changing palette, perfectly timed to coincide with the joyous occasion of Mother's Day. Featuring a curated selection of paintings by acclaimed artists Cl√©mence Prosen and Rebecca Fitzsimons, "The 4 Seasons" offers a mesmerizing journey through the vibrant hues and tranquil landscapes that define each season. From the delicate blossoms of spring to the fiery hues of autumn, each artwork captures the essence of nature's timeless beauty, inviting viewers to immerse themselves in the sights and sensations of the natural world. As we approach Mother's Day, what better way to honour the special women in our lives than with a heartfelt tribute to the beauty of nature? Whether you're seeking the perfect gift for a beloved mother or simply wish to indulge in a moment of tranquility and reflection, "The 4 Seasons" exhibition offers an unforgettable experience for all. In addition to the original oil paintings, the exhibition will feature a selection of art prints, Irish Counties Prints, Mindful Illustrations, Greeting Cards, and Home Accessories for your Calm SpaceTM, including the popular calming soft velvet cushions. Join us at The Red Stables, St Anne‚Äôs Park in Dublin, from March 5th to March 11th to discover the magic of "The 4 Seasons" and celebrate the timeless allure of nature's ever-changing landscape. Admission is free, making it the perfect opportunity to treat yourself and your loved ones to a memorable artistic experience this Mother's Day week. For more information, please contact Clemence Prosen, prosen.artist@gmail.com - www.clemenceprosen.com or contact Rebecca Fitzsimons, hello@splashydashyart.com - www.splashydashyart.com -------
Title: "The 4 Seasons" Art, Home & Gift
Subtitle: Vibrant Artistry Returns to the Red Stables: "The 4 Seasons" Exhibition by Renowned Irish and French Artists

Description: We are pleased to invite adult women aged 18 and above to a free taster session where you will have the opportunity to experience the physical and mental benefits of Aikido.  Our goal is to provide a safe and encouraging environment for you to explore and learn this martial art. Our experienced instructors will guide you through the session, where you will be introduced to the fundamentals of safe falling and basic Aikido movements and techniques.  After the session, we will be pleased to offer you a 50% discount for the first month if you decide to join us. Our regular classes are designed to accommodate all levels of experience, from beginners to advanced practitioners. We believe that Aikido is more than just a physical exercise, it is a way of life. It teaches you how to harmonize your mind and body and cultivates a sense of peace and mindfulness.  Join us for this free taster session and discover the transformative power of Aikido. Date: 10 March 2024 Time: 14:15 - 15:45 Venue: 51 Hampton Street, Balbriggan, Co. Dublin Please wear any comfortable clothes with long sleeves.  #FingalSports #WomenInSportsIRE
Title: Women in Sport Week - Come and Try Aikido
Subtitle: A free Aikido taster session in partnership with Fingal Sports Office.

Description: Scientology Sunday Service is a perfect time to unwind. Scientology doesn't tell you what to believe, it is rather about discovering the truth for yourself. As every sermon begins: "Nothing in Scientology is true for you unless you have observed it and it is true according to your observation." (L. Ron Hubbard) Scientology Sunday Service aims to help you overcome troubled moments in life, be it on personal or community level, and is best known for the positive message which every sermon carries. All faiths, or none, are welcome! Enjoy a nice cup of tea, coffee, and refreshments afterward. UPCOMING SERVICES & TOPICS: FOR MORE INFORMATION: Contact us on 01 541 8000 or email us at info.dublin@scientology.net. Click here to view our Privacy Policy, Terms & Conditions and full Copyrights notice. ¬© 2024 Church of Scientology & Community Centre of Dublin. Normally we take photos and video at our events which may be used for our own promotional use (social media, website) and your registration confirms your consent to this use. If you object to this please let reception know on the day of the event upon your arrival, and we will take steps to ensure your preference is respected.
Title: Scientology Sunday Service

Description: Meditate, meet and get motivated.  You learn and practice meditation and learn how to apply it to different and difficult situations in life.  We recommend joining by laptop for better experience. All levels welcome. You will find experience of this online class very real life like and in fact more attentive and personal. Join us on Facebook for more resources- more live events, recorded sessions, self learning units, mentorship, downloads and some light hearted socialization. https://www.facebook.com/groups/WeMeditateGroup The gentle and easy technique shared is known as 'Sahaja Yoga' meditation and is practiced in more than 100 countries and is always free. It was founded in 1970 by- Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi. When practiced for 10 minutes a day it can lead to dramatic positive change in your personal life - even after one week of practice! More at: https://sahajayogareview.wordpress.com/ You can join up to 30 minutes before start of event if you have some queries or would like some one to one help. This is a recurring session that serves beginners and above. No prior experience needed.  After few sessions you are placed in next level where introduction is skipped and we share more techniques. 1. Learn how to meditate at home 2. Learn best practices and techniques 3. Experience the 'awakening' of healing energy within us that gives peace and balance 4. Acquire Sahaja Yoga meditation toolkit resources to apply techniques learnt in daily life Meditation is proven by science to be beneficial.  In Sahaja Yoga you will be able to perceive the awakening and balance that comes along. Real people, real experiences: https://sahajayogareview.wordpress.com/ Resources: https://www.freemeditation.com/ How to Meditate- the basics: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HTJtS-nIzME Initial Guided Meditation: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RRO_0Aptwts&t=9s Please feel free to email or WhatsApp following in case you have more questions or face difficulties joining Zoom session. We will try to keep you informed about more meditation events. Bhargava.potukuchi@gmail.com+15132038961 Join WhatsApp Group Link https://chat.whatsapp.com/K9ijSF8Ss8uBXs0UOu8yC3 Stay safe and keep meditating! Free Sahaja Yoga Guided Meditation Founded in 1970 by 'Shri Mataji Nirmala Devi' Sahaja Yoga is a simple but profound technique and always free Just with pure desire we get meditative once we awaken our Divine energy Depression and stress are fruits of modernity Techniques are shared that help when practiced with regularity Sorrow just peel off when in meditative witness state and purity Be with meditative people with noble pursuits to shed social anxiety Sahaja Yoga is a meditation very social with spiritual growth achieved in collectivity In balanced and joyous state eliminate loneliness with spiritual solidarity Life transformation & change coming from sermons speeches have no durability Work on inner system roots, water with pure desire and shine some Divinity In Sahaja Yoga meditation following comes automatically Metaphysics, Consciousness, Self improvement, self empowerment, mindfulness and mental clarity Meditation is not a pill but a plant needing nourishment with sincerity While we cannot predict through meditation what heights you will achieve in life Our heart felt desire is to always share joy and knowledge in simplicity Our experiences say you will not be ordinary any more, shaken easily by any rife Sunday Free Guided Meditation class. Easy, practical and useful. Meditate for spiritual awakening , stress care, joy & health. Register now! Description: TAKE OUR IQ, APTITUDE AND PERSONALITY TESTS  (Our tests are available in 17 languages) You are a unique individual with your own personality traits‚Äîsome of these traits can enable you to achieve great things in life, and others can hold you back and ultimately stifle your true potential. Your IQ, Aptitude and Personality can determine your future success and happiness. Thousands of people the world over have taken these tests to see what they should improve in their lives. All tests are followed by a one-on-one consultation with practical recommendations tailored to your needs based on your results. T he tests, grading and consultation are completely free of charge. You will receive written results and an evaluation which you can take home with you. O ur consultants will make recommendations to you as part of your consultation, there is no obligation to accept them. GET TO KNOW THE REAL YOU Most of our lives we‚Äôve been taught to believe that personality is a genetic trait that cannot be changed and that you just have to ‚Äúdeal with it.‚Äù This is simply not true. You can change your personality and become a much better, happier version of yourself, one that faces and conquers the challenges of life with knowledge and ease. WITH THESE TESTS YOU CAN: GOT A QUESTION? CONTACT US! You can write us an email through Eventbrite or call us on 01 541 8000. Description: Ever wonder..what's down there? Well my friend today is the day we explore the alternative side to Dublin.Come check out a chocolate factory, fruit market, hidden bar, time house, art gallery and many more unique places. We are starting beside The Ambassador Theatre at the top of O Connel Street. Your guide will be at the front door from 10.58 to 11.10 https://www.google.com/maps/@53.3525443,-6.2618399,2a,75y,323h,81.18t/data=!3m6!1e1!3m4!1s1X_qcDx_H520gAu91ABlgw!2e0!7i13312!8i6656   I will be outside the front door to the right from 10.58am until 11.10am. My number is 0863334177, call me only if you are lost. (First stop is The Chocolate Factory - Google it if you're late)#   This is a free walking tour but I do accept cash tips or revolut if you want to support the free tour system.   The tour will end in Temple Bar.   SEE YOU AT 11AM   This will be a two hour tour and end in Temple Bar. PRIVATE TOURS We are also now doing private tours for groups, if you want to host your own tour get in touch with us. LIKE THIS BUT CAN'T ATTEND? Signup to the Alternative Dublin newsletter to find out about what's happening in the city https://forms.gle/6T6s6zg7wet5kv5k9 WHAT ELSE DO WE DO? We host art nights, pottery, walking tours, workshops, storytelling and lots of whacky events. Join us for Drink & Draw Ireland's art party or one of our many experiences. FAQ? What happens if I'm late? We encourage anyone who is late to still join the tour, after you get a ticket you will get an email that will have instructions. What happens if it rains? All tours proceed even if it's raining, please bring an umbrella or rain jacket just in case. FREE TOUR? Really? Yes this is free, if you enjoy it you can tip your guide if you want. Our guides keep all tips from tours so it gives artists and creatives a chance to do something they love.
Title: Alternative Side to Dublin Tour
Subtitle:
Discover a different side to Dublin on an alternative walking tour.
Visit a chocolate factory, art gallery , a secret bar and more.

Experience the 'awakening' of healing energy within us that gives peace and balance 4. Acquire Sahaja Yoga meditation toolkit resources to apply techniques learnt in daily life Meditation is proven by science to be beneficial. Description: A wonderful Free concert of choral music by a talented American University choir from East Tennesse and an Irish choir from Dublin City University not to be missed !! The East Tennessee State University Chorale, under the direction of Dr. Alan Stevens and accompanied by Erin Raines, has toured throughout the United States and Internationally. Members of Chorale are chosen through a selective audition process and must be dedicated to the highest level of choral artistry. The group performs in a variety of styles and genres, ranging from music of the Renaissance to newly composed works to pop to jazz. The Chorale has hosted a series of guest artists on the ETSU campus, including Chanticleer, VOCES 8, The Swingles, and New York Voices. Chorale presents a four-concert season each year, and annually tours regionally. . A repertoire which includes : TitleComposer/ArrangerA Choral FanfareJohn RutterYe Shall Have a SongRandall ThompsonThe Work of LoveDaniel GawthropMy God Is A Rockarr. Parker and ShawLeron, Leron Sintaarr. Saunder ChoiThe Blue BirdCharles V. StanfordJoy Joy Joyarr. Robert PageDie Onse VaderZander FickTuttaranaReena EsmailPrayerRene ClausenI'm a Trainarr. Peter KnightCome What Mayarr. Theo Hicks, Kevin KellerThe Times They Are A-Changin'arr. Adam PoddAwake My SoulElaine HagenbergThis World Is Not My Homearr. Russell Mauldin, Josh McPheeters Dublin City University Chamber Choir is a relatively new but very talented choir led by Kevin Boushel They performed for the national broadcaster RTE just two months after the choir was first established. Members of the choir come from all of the university's five faculties, and comprises a mix of undergraduate, postgraduate and international students. Singers have a variety of musical backgrounds, with singers from church choirs, school choirs, musical theatre, folk singing and pop music. The Chamber Choir is the first University-wide auditioned chamber choir, performing a repertoire and highlighting music by living and Irish composers.
Title: FREE CHORAL CONCERT IN DUBLIN
Subtitle: A wonderful Free concert of Choral music in a lovely chapel in DCU Campus

Description: Asymmetric Basket Willow Basketry is a skill that our ancestors would have passed down throughout history, with willow baskets being used throughout Ireland for any number of tasks. They are the original eco, reusable shopping bag well before plastics came into being.  This Asymmetric Basket Workshop adds a twist to the normal basket style, the handle is a piece of wood, for example, a piece of driftwood or another lovely natural piece of wood. You can bring in your piece of wood and we will show you how to incorporate it into your creation. Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt have anything suitable, we will supply something for you. The tutor for these workshops is Kate Burrows, who after training in Somerset in the UK some 9 years ago, has continued to increase her basket-making skills and knowledge, alongside teaching many people this heritage craft. This class is a one-day workshop that will last about 6 hours, throughout which Kate will teach you to make your very own Asymmetric Willow Basket, and will cover all the basics. At the end of the day, you will be able to take your basket home, which you can treasure for a lifetime. All materials are Supplied Please note the 'Deposits, Missed Days and Missed Classes Refund Policy' below Leitrim School of Art (LSA) Deposits, Missed Days and Missed Classes Refund Policy from December 2022 (Revised April 2023) (a)	Due to substantial increases in business costs LSA cannot offer discounts, refunds, or alternative places on future events for missed classes within class blocks, or missed days within workshops and camps (b)	A request for a refund of a deposit may be considered if the refund request is received by LSA at least 10 days before the start of the event. (c)	A request to transfer a deposit to another event may be considered if the request to transfer is received by LSA at least 10 days before the start of the originally booked event. (d)	Requests for refunds or transfer of deposits must be notified to LSA by email to michael@leitrimartschool.ie (e)	Requests for refunds will be responded to by LSA within 3 days of the request being notified to us. (f)	Your statutory rights as a consumer are not affected and LSA will ‚Äúmake good‚Äù on its obligations to consumers for failure to provide classes or workshop and camp days (e.g., event cancellation). (g)	Booking of an event at LSA, through Eventbrite or otherwise, constitutes your acceptance of this policy.

Description: Join our Roscommon branch as we are returning to our Lecarrow Wood to give our trees orginating from St John's Wood some much needed TLC (Tender Loving Care). These consist of Oak, Hazel and Tutsan shrubs all collected from seed from St John's Wood. We also have work to do within our nursery and polytunnel including: moving some gravel and manure. We may even get to some trail clearance if time allows! We'd love your help as we move closer to our goal of expanding St. Johns wood, the most natural ancient woodland in the midlands and an important part of Irish natural heritage. Where/Parking: Our Lecarrow nature reserve (Google Maps link: https://goo.gl/maps/hHuuxnGzfhYkmi5R9) When: 10:30am ‚Äì 2pm Sunday 10th March 2024 Age limit: All ages are welcome. Anybody under the age of 18 should be accompanied by a parent or guardian at all times. What to bring: We will be providing tea, coffee and biscuits. If you have a reusable coffee/tea cup, please bring this along to minimize waste on the day. Bathroom Facilities: We regret to advise that there are no bathroom facilities at our Lecarrow nature reserve, however the nearby village of Lecarrow is under 7 minutes‚Äô drive from the site. Cancellation Note: Events may be cancelled on short notice if there are adverse weather conditions or weather warnings in place. In the event that we do cancel an event on short notice, we will send an email to inform you as early as possible. We really appreciate your support. You'll be helping us to achieve our mission not only to conserve the ancient woodland tree and shrub genetics found within St. Johns Wood, but helping us to spread the woodland into our nearby reserve, and among other landowners and groups nearby. Native Woodland Trust Contact: Jeremy Casey 0871953629 and Aaron Gallagher 0879619083
Title: Lecarrow Reserve (Roscommon) Native Tree Nursery Day and Tree TLC
Subtitle: Roll up your sleeves with our Roscommon branch of volunteers as we continue work in our tree nursery and give our planted trees some TLC!

Description: Opened in 1855, Balmoral Cemetery is the final resting place of numerous individuals who made a contribution to the Belfast of yesteryear. This tour, lasting at least one hour, will call at more than 20 headstones with local taphophile (tombstone tourist) Peter McCabe making a brief introduction to each. Stops will include suffragist Isabella Tod, architects William Batt, John Young and Robert McKenzie, and Presbyterian ministers Reverends Henry Cooke, Hugh Hanna and Joseph Mackenzie. The tour will also call at the graves of Rachel Mercer who died ‚Äòfrom injuries received in the collision between SS Dromedary and SS Alligator‚Äô on 12th August 1900, and Samuel Young MP who, on his death in 1918 at the age of 96, was the oldest-ever member of the UK Parliament. Parking is available at Malone Presbyterian Church nearby.
Title: Balmoral Cemetery walking tour
Subtitle: An hour-long guided walking tour of Balmoral Cemetery (this cemetery is usually closed, with access kindly provided by Belfast City Council)

Description: Bringing you a special screening at The Black Box, in partnership with Cosmic Cat and The New Black `Film Collective, presents - CASSIUS X:BECOMING ALI CASSIUS X: Becoming Ali follows the early years of Cassius Clay, from bright-eyed rookie to world heavyweight champion and from working class intellectual to one of America‚Äôs most influential civil rights campaigners. CASSIUS X: Becoming Ali is the extraordinary story of how one young boxer from Louisville, Kentucky became a cultural icon for the ages, forever to be known thereafter as ‚ÄúThe Greatest‚Äù. Dir: Muta'Ali Cert: 12A Dur: 90mins Panel: Jake McBride (Hooked Belfast) - Hosted by Isabella Koban (Ghouls On Film) ----------------------------- 6:00pm: Doors open + Intro by Host 6:30pm: Film starts promptly 8:00pm: Film finishes and panel starts 8:30pm: Panel finishes and exit venue ------------------------------ Tickets: ¬£10 No children under 12 years old allowed. See details about The Black Box accessibility here. ------------------------------ The Black Box: A home of film, live music, comedy, theatre and one of the leading lights of the city‚Äôs arts and entertainment sector. A not-for-profit arts venue, the Black Box works closely with community initiatives. Cosmic Cat: A film distributor and impact production company that specialises in creating and releasing thought-provoking content. Our mission is to make a positive social impact through the stories we tell. The New Black `Film Collective (TNBFC): Established with a mission to create and cultivate a vibrant Black ecosystem within the UK film and TV sector. The collective champions Black-led film production, distribution, exhibition, and the preservation of Black filmmaking and television.
Title: CASSIUS X:BECOMING ALI + PANEL
Subtitle: Cassius X follows the early years of Cassius Clay, from bright-eyed rookie to world heavyweight champion!

Description: Synthesis of the human Mind Our internal world drives our external world. Our ability to use our mind determines how well we can control our external realities. What you may not know is that our Minds have an identity. Creating an Identity of mind allows us to direct our external world intentionally. The language we use to run our lives is one dimensional, which creates needless limitations. Our minds work best in a multidimensional language. Learning how to access your minds resources correctly will enable you to create a life beyond who we desire to be. Our vocabulary, are words we use internally to motivate change, but instead of encouraging us, the imperfections in our speech and articulation restrict access to our minds. There is no synchronicity between the one-dimensional language in our speech and the 4 th dimension of the mind. If you‚Äôre not using the correct language of the mind, the mind disengages where we become confused. We don‚Äôt have the language to describe the life that we want in a way that the mind accepts, understands, and can utilise. Mind ReMapping is a language illuminating an internal identity, so that we no longer need to be afraid of the dark, neither do we need to be afraid of our minds and what the future holds for us. Meta Tech Organica ‚Äì Excited about Dimensions of LIVING D0 ‚Äì Orientation ‚Äì Who you are & who you are NOT. D1 ‚Äì Point of Focus ‚Äì What Where When Why & How to SEE. D2 ‚Äì Objectification ‚Äì Finding Imagination. D3 ‚Äì Understanding ‚Äì 4 Dimensions of Quadrilateral Thinking D4 ‚Äì TIME ‚Äì Mind ReMapping.(Cognitive Positioning System) Thank you for your patience. Mind ReMapping N.B. ALL EVENTS ARE ONLINE
Title: Mind ReMapping - LOST WITHOUT AN  IDENTITY CRISIS  - ONLINE - Belfast
Subtitle: The MIND ReMapping  Philosophy: "Be so Creatively removed from reality, that the Mind has no choice, but to come out of hiding‚Ä¶."

Description:
The joint Falls/Shankill Tour is a unique experience, blending the narratives of local republican former
 prisoners telling their story of the past decades whilst guiding visitors through the republican areas of West
 Belfast and then, at the famous gates of the Peace Wall, handing over the visitors to former loyalists activists
 to hear their narratives of their localities. This gives a unique first hand narrative of experiences across
 Belfast communities.
 This three hours tour allows visitors to explore both the nationalist Falls Road and the unionist Shankill Road
 areas of Belfast. On the nationalist leg of the tour, the visitor will see the world famous International Wall with
 its political artworks, the Republican Memorial Garden and the world famous mural of Bobby Sands. This tour tracks the course of the ‚ÄúPeace Wall‚Äù and goes through Clonard with its famous Clonard Monastery
 Church and Bombay Street, the epicentre of events in 1969. The group will be then handed over to the
 loyalist tour guide who will bring it on to the Shankill Area, to hear the unionist/loyalist perspective on our
 past and visit local sites of interest.
 This 3 hours walking tour starts at the Coiste‚Äôs mural at Divis Tower (Divis Street) and finishes on the Lower
 Shankill Road.
Title: Joint Falls/Shankill Tour
Subtitle: Welcome to Coiste na nIarchim√≠‚Äôs original West Belfast bespoke walking tours, delivered by former political prisoners.

Description: Would you love to learn how to use a sewing machine and start altering your clothes for a better fit? Maybe you want to make clothes or lovely things for your home? This is the perfect course for you, as you will learn to sew on a machine from scratch in a beautiful fashion design studio in Conway Mill, Belfast. The tutor is studio owner MaryRose McGrath - a womenswear designer with 25 years in the fashion industry. During her career, she has designed for many brands, including Oasis, M&S, Debenhams, Arcadia, House Of Fraser and more. You will be taught the sewing techniques used in the industry - also included are many more nifty tips and tricks of the trade, which guarantee superb sewing results every time. During class, you will be surrounded by inspiration galore in the studio - actual designs in work, fabrics, mood boards, mannequins & sketches. One-to-one tuition is also guaranteed for each student in class, and the course has been specifically designed to fast-track your sewing success in a concentrated period of time. All this means you will advance from a nervous novice to a confident maker by the end of the day! For past student feedback, see our fantastic course reviews below....... The course includes: A FULL DAY OF IN-DEPTH SEWING TUITION IN A WORKING FASHION STUDIO, PLUS THE USE OF A BROTHER SEWING MACHINE & ALL OUR PROFESSIONAL EQUIPMENT. YOU WILL LEARN THE FOLLOWING: 1. Your sewing kit - the important tools essential for successful work. 2. UNDERSTANDING THE SEWING MACHINE: * What machine should you choose if buying one? Top tips & recommendations. * An easy-to-understand explanation of the sewing machines confusing dials & knobs, what each does 3. HOW TO SEW LIKE A PRO: * How to thread the machine correctly - learn about threads and why your choice matters * How to wind the bobbin properly * How to sew with precision - how to achieve perfect seams each time * Seam allowances & why they matter in sewing & alterations 4. BEGINNER GARMENT ALTERATIONS TECHNIQUES: * Fitting garments- a full explanation of beginner fitting techniques and why ease matters when altering garments. * How to hem a garment * How to take in or let out seams * How to sew darts to add shaping to a garment Where is the course held? The course is held in MaryRose's fashion design studio in Conway Mill, Belfast. The address is Conway Mill, 5-7 Conway Street, Belfast BT13 2DE. Who is the course suitable for? This course is perfect for absolute beginners who have never used a sewing machine before and haven't a clue where to start - it is also ideal for those who have not sewn in years and need a refresher course to get back on track. Garment alterations are covered too, so the course is suited for those who want to tailor their clothes for a better fit. What age do you have to be to take part in the class? Classes are for ages 18+. Young sewers aged 12+ are also welcome if they are accompanied by a parent/guardian who is also booked on the course. Do I need to bring a sewing machine with me? No need - we supply excellent Brother sewing machines for all students in class. What do I need to bring with me on the day? We supply your machine, fabrics and threads, however, you will need to bring the following: * Reading glasses if you need them for close-up work * A notebook and pen for all the notes and important info you will be taught in class. How many students are in the class? Eight students maximum are in the class. We specifically keep classes small to ensure you get lots of one-to-one tuition with MaryRose during the day - the ultimate way to learn. How much does the course cost? The course includes 6 hours of intensive sewing tuition (4 classes in one day), the use of the design studio, practice fabrics & threads and a Brother sewing machine to learn on. The course cost is ¬£99. How do I book the course? You can book this course here through Eventbrite using PayPal. Eventbrite charges a booking fee. OR You can book the course through the studio, for no booking fee. Please e-mail us at info@maryrosemcgrath.com, or call 02895 215683 to book through the studio. We will call to book you in and take payment by card over the phone - this confirms your booking. Can I contact the studio if I have any questions? Yes, you can e-mail us at info@maryrosemcgrath.com or call on 02895 215683 - we are always happy to help. If calling the studio, phone any day from Tuesday to Friday between 10-5 pm. (Calls are not picked up on Mondays or weekends as classes are in progress). Where can I have lunch on the day? The studio closes at lunchtime; students can have lunch in one of the cafes in the local vicinity. I can't make this date - are there any other dates available for this course? Yes, the other dates available to book are: Saturday 2nd March - all day course Two part evening course - Tuesdays 5th & 12th March See all listings here on Eventbrite. Can I buy a sewing machine on the day? Yes, we sell the superb Brother sewing machines you use to learn in class. WHERE TO MEET BEFORE CLASS STARTS: The studio is closed before class, and doors open at 9:30 a.m. MaryRose will collect all students from Conway Mill reception on the ground floor at 9.25 a.m. and take you to the studio on the second floor. ( Please do not try and find the studio as you will get lost ). Any other important information I should know before booking a space on the course? TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF BOOKING:  1. Late arrivals: There is a huge amount to learn in the all-day class - late arrivals disrupt students, the tutor and the teaching schedule. Late arrivals of 15 minutes or more are not accepted into class as it is impossible to recap after this time. 2. Non-attendance: Due to the small number of students in class & the niche nature of this course, a new beginners course on another date / refunds / class credit notes / class vouchers are not provided if the student has not attended the course for any reason including : covid / covid isolation/ illness / unexpected or personal circumstances / transport  / other.   3: You can transfer the booking to another person if you can not attend: If you can not make the course for any reason - you can transfer the name so someone else attends the course in your place. To transfer a name, please call the studio a minimum of 24 hours before the course starts to inform us of the name change. Please ensure you call during office hours from Tuesday to Friday, 9 am to 5.00 pm. The telephone number is 02895 215683.  * e-mails are not accepted to transfer a name to another person. 4. Course cancellation: On rare occasions, classes may have to be cancelled due to unforeseen circumstances. We will inform students immediately by e-mailing & calling. You will be offered a refund, a transfer to another date, or a credit note. Please note we are not liable for any costs incurred. 5. Speed of learning: Progress and speed of learning depends on each student's natural abilities during class. 6. A minimum of two students are required for this course to take place.
Title: BEGINNERS INTRODUCTION TO SEWING & ALTERATIONS:  Sunday 10th March
Subtitle:
LEARN TO SEW ON A MACHINE WITH CONFIDENCE!
Learn-in-a- day, absolute beginner sewing & alterations course in Conway Mill Belfast.

Description: Step into the shadowy streets of Belfast and immerse yourself in a thrilling city exploration game. You'll discover hidden gems and uncover the mysterious stories that lie within the city. This is an experience that will transport you to a different time and place. Join if you love adventure, mystery, and discovery as you uncover the dark tales of old Belfast.  The route you‚Äôre going to follow in the city is sprinkled with eerie places, fun clues and challenges, and horror stories of past and present. The experience will play out like you‚Äôre the main characters of a movie, only that you‚Äôre experiencing everything in the first person! Fun dialogue, intrigue, and unexpected interactions are guaranteed. HOW IT WORKS‚ùì 1. Book your tickets üé´ 2. Download the Questo app - it's free üì≤] 3. Description: Amerghin: Wind on Sea Between them they have played with artists from Led Zeppelin to the Chieftains, Elvis Costello, In Tua Nua, Riverdance, and Mamady Keita, and in concert, chamber and baroque orchestras around the world, on more than 150 albums, in more than 50 countries. They have played every style of venue and festival in Ireland from music bars to concert halls and stadia, and from fleadhs and baroque festivals to Electric Picnics. Their combined experience as professional musicians spans 150 years. The four members of Amerghin combine that experience to create stunning new compositions and improvisations, which co-exist on their set list with music that is older than most nations. Whether it is music from the seventeenth century or new music being improvised into existence in front of your ears, Amerghin breathe new life into everything they play. For Finding a Voice 2024, Amerghin perform music by M√°ire Breatnach, Irish-American fiddler Liz Carroll, Italian baroque composer Isabella Leonarda, French baroque composer Elizabeth-Claude Jacquet de la Guerre, West African kora player and composer Sona Jobarte, and composer and harpist Anne-Marie O'Farrell.  The concert will also feature the world premi√®re of a specially commissioned work for the ensemble by Ad√®le O'Dwyer Forever Flowing, inspired by Clonmel's rich history and dedicated to one of the town's most famous sons, composer Miche√°l √ì S√∫illeabh√°in. Whether you are a traditional music enthusiast or simply seeking adventurous new sounds, Amerghin: Wind on Sea is an event you don't want to miss. Book your spot now!
Title: Amerghin: Wind on Sea
Subtitle: Amerghin: Wind on Sea, music from the seventeenth century to the present day performed by an incredible line-up of musicians
