Description: An exclusive experience at Eden on a Sunday afternoon.... Riding on the success of our last event, we are now ready to offer a special Mother‚Äôs day experience here at Eden Pottery. Everyone will receive a long-lasting pottery piece to remember a unique event. Choose from a set selection of pottery, and enjoy a drink and a plate full of delicious treats whilst you decorate. We will show you how to print/paint your own masterpiece! Painting will be in our seated and decorated cafe area. About this workshop:Get creative with our Pottery Painting afternoon, using our fun and creative handmade sponges, or take up a small brush and channel your inner Bob Ross!Choose your pottery piece on the day (Pottery items for this event are small vases, bowls, jugs or mugs) We have 2 different time slots available: 12:30pm-2:30pm 3pm-5pm The maximun # of tickets you can purchase is 4 Added extras:But that's not all.... you will receive a hot or cold drink of your choice, and a selection of home baked goodies to nibble whilst you paint! (Heart shaped scones with jam and cream, brownie piece for the chocolate lovers, and a slice each of our popular Victoria sponge, and Coffee cakes) Who is this for?Ideal for a special Mother‚Äôs day trip out, whether you‚Äôre a Daughter or Mum! (Dad‚Äôs and son‚Äôs also welcome..!) What is the cost?The cost for this event is ¬£35 per person When will my pottery be ready?Your pottery will be ready for collection 7-10 working days after the event. (Or you can arrange postage) Please contact us on 02891862300 or sales@edenpotteryshop.co.uk if you have any queries!
Title: Mother's Day at Eden
Subtitle: Pottery Decorating and Light Refreshments

Between 4:00 and 6:00pm there will be a time of quiet guided prayer and reflection to consider what God has been doing ,and wants to do, in you this Lent. You will be welcome to complete the afternoon by joining us for the Candlelight Mass in St Patrick‚Äôs Church at 6:00pm. You will be invited to make a small donation (if you can) on the day to defray costs.

Description: Join us at 38-40 Comber Road, Dundonald, BT16 2AA for an exciting in-person gathering of Crosspoint Kid's Church on Sunday, October 1st, 2023 at 11:30 AM.  Get ready for a fun-filled time of worship, games, and learning about God's love. Our dedicated team of volunteers will engage your kids in interactive activities and teach them important values through age-appropriate lessons.  At Crosspoint Kid's Church, we create a safe and welcoming environment for children to grow spiritually and build friendships. Don't miss out on this opportunity for your kids to connect with God and other children their age. Mark your calendars and bring your little ones along for an unforgettable experience at Crosspoint Kid's Church!

Description: Would you love to learn how to use a sewing machine and start making your own clothes and accessories? Maybe you want to alter, revamp, or make lovely things for your home? This is the perfect course for you, as you will learn to sew on a machine from scratch in a beautiful fashion design studio in Conway Mill, Belfast. The tutor is studio owner MaryRose McGrath - a womenswear designer with 25 years in the fashion industry. During her career, she has designed for many brands, including Oasis, M&S, Debenhams, Arcadia, House Of Fraser and more. You will be taught the sewing techniques used in the industry - also included are many more nifty tips and tricks of the trade, which guarantee superb sewing results every time. During class, you will be surrounded by inspiration galore in the studio - actual designs in work, fabrics, mood boards, mannequins & sketches. One-to-one tuition is also guaranteed for each student in class, and the course has been specifically designed to fast-track your sewing success in a concentrated period of time. All this means you will advance from a nervous novice to a confident maker by the end of the two evenings. For past student feedback, see our fantastic course reviews below....... LEARN THE FOLLOWING: * What machine should you choose if buying one? Top tips & recommendations. * An easy-to-understand explanation of the sewing machines confusing dials & knobs, what each does * How to thread the machine correctly - learn about threads and why your choice matters * How to wind the bobbin properly * How to sew with precision - how to achieve perfect seams each time * Seam allowances & why they matter in sewing & alterations * Fitting garments- a full explanation of beginner fitting techniques and why ease matters when altering garments. * How to hem a garment * How to take in or let out seams * How to sew darts to add shaping to a garment TWO EVENINGS OF IN-DEPTH SEWING TUITION , PLUS THE USE OF A BROTHER SEWING MACHINE & ALL OUR PROFESSIONAL EQUIPMENT. ALL FABRICS & THREADS ARE INCLUDED. Where is the course held? The course is held in MaryRose's fashion design studio in Conway Mill, Belfast. The address is Conway Mill, 5-7 Conway Street, Belfast BT13 2DE. Who is the course suitable for? This course is perfect for absolute beginners who have never used a sewing machine before and haven't a clue where to start - it is also ideal for those who have not sewn in years and need a refresher course to get back on track. Garment alterations are covered too, so the course is suited for those who want to tailor their clothes for a better fit. What age do you have to be to take part in the class? Classes are for ages 18+. Young sewers aged 12+ are also welcome if they are accompanied by a parent/guardian who is also booked on the course. Do I need to bring a sewing machine with me? No need - we supply excellent Brother sewing machines for all students in class. What do I need to bring with me? We supply your machine, fabrics and threads, however, you will need to bring the following: * Reading glasses if you need them for close-up work * A notebook and pen for all the notes and important info you will be taught in class. How many students are in the class? Eight students maximum are in the class. We specifically keep classes small to ensure you get lots of one-to-one tuition with MaryRose during the course - the ultimate way to learn. How much does the course cost? The course includes 6 hours of intensive sewing tuition (4 classes over two evenings), the use of the design studio, practice fabrics & threads and a Brother sewing machine to learn on. The course cost is ¬£99. How do I book the course? You can book this course here through Eventbrite using PayPal. Eventbrite charges a booking fee. OR You can book the course through the studio, with no booking fee added. Please e-mail your contact details to: info@maryrosemcgrath.com, or call 02895 215683 to book through the studio. We take payment by card over the phone - this confirms your booking. I can't make this date - are there any other dates available for this course? Yes, the other dates available to book are: Saturday 2nd March - all day course Sunday 10th March - all day course Saturday 20th April - all day course See all class listings on Eventbrite. WHERE TO MEET BEFORE CLASS STARTS: The studio is closed before class, and doors open at 6.15 pm. MaryRose will collect all students from Conway Mill reception on the ground floor at 6.10 pm and take you to the studio on the second floor. ( Please do not try and find the studio as you may get lost ). Is there any other important information I should know before booking a space on the course? PLEASE READ THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF BOOKING BELOW : 1. Late arrivals: There is a huge amount to learn in the course- late arrivals disrupt students, the tutor and the teaching schedule. Late arrivals of 15 minutes or more are not accepted into class as it is impossible to recap after this time. 2. Non-attendance: Due to the small number of students in class & the niche nature of this course, refunds / a new beginners course on another date/credit notes or vouchers are not provided if the student has not attended any part of the course for any reason including : Covid/covid isolation/ illness / unexpected circumstances or events/ transport / personal circumstances / other. 3: Transfer the booking to another person if you can not attend: If you can not make the course (including covid/covid isolation/illness / unexpected circumstances or events /transport/ personal circumstances / other), you can transfer the name - so someone else attends the course in your place. To transfer a name, call us a minimum of 24 hours before the course starts to inform us of the name change. Please ensure you call us during office hours from Tuesday to Friday, 9 am to 5.00 pm. The studio telephone number is 02895 215683. * Please note that e-mails or social media messages are not accepted to transfer the name of a person attending class. 4. Course cancellation: On rare occasions, classes may have to be cancelled due to unforeseen circumstances. We will inform students immediately by e-mailing & calling. You will be offered a refund, a transfer to another date, or a credit note. Please note we are not liable for any costs incurred. 5. Speed of learning: Progress and speed of learning depends on each student's natural abilities during class. 6. A minimum of two students are required for this course to take place. 7.The student booked onto the course must attend the first evening class, in order to be able to attend the second class. Should a student not attend the first class for any reason, they will not have learned the skills needed to be able to attend the second class. Please note that refunds or partial refunds / a new beginners evening course on another date/class credit notes or vouchers are not provided if the student has not attended any part of the course for any reason including : Covid/covid isolation/ illness / unexpected circumstances or events/ transport / personal circumstances / other. 8.One person attends both sessions, it is not possible to split the classes between two people.
Title: BEGINNERS INTRODUCTION TO SEWING & ALTERATIONS - TUESDAY EVENINGS COURSE
Subtitle:
LEARN TO SEW ON A MACHINE WITH CONFIDENCE!
Absolute beginner sewing & alterations course in Conway Mill Belfast - 2 part evening course
